question.text: After conventional radiation therapy for head and cancer, the patient is at increased risk for dental caries

choices.choice: For 6 months after the end of radiotherapy
Fro the first year after radiotherapy
For the rest of their life

messages.message:
Correct Answer
D - For the rest of their life

question.text: Most long term dental care for patients who have been treated for cancer is provided by

messages.message:
Correct Answer
D - General dentists in private practice

question.text: Which of the following is the most common oral complication of head and radiation therapy?

messages.message:
Correct Answer
C - Salivary gland hypofunction and xerostomia

choices.choice: A drug used to treat oral candidiasis
A drug used to spare salivary glands during radiation treatment
A drug used to stimulate salivary fallow following radiation therapy

messages.message:
Correct Answer
B - A drug used to spare salivary glands during radiation treatment

choices.choice: Extracting "at risk" teeth at least two weeks before radiation therapy
Preventing dental caries and periodontal disease
Using meticulous oral surgical techniques if teeth need to be extracted following radiation therapy
None of the above have been shown to decrease risk of ORN

question.text: Silicone mucosal guards that cover teeth that are heavily restored with metal

choices.choice: Are worn during radiation therapy to reduce scatter
Reduce heat generated by metal restorations touching mucosa
Can help reduce severity of oral mucositis from radiation thearpy
